issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When upgrading a cloud from 4.1.0 to 4.1.1 the UFS and SC services fail to start. The exception indicates a 4.1.0 message error (some log attached). I verified each host was in fact running 4.1.1 packages. The DB upgrade was successful it was only when bringing other components back up that the issue is seen.

Topology:
\[CLC CC\]
\[WALRUS UFS\]
\[SC\]
\[NC\]

sample of the exception
{code}
2015-04-21 10:23:39 ERROR | CHECK:null  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.166:euare:API_10.111.5.166.euare/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [Action:ProblemAction Code:soapenv:Server Id:RelatesTo Error: com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServicesException: No unmarshaller for element "{http://msgs.eucalyptus.com/4.1.0}StartServiceType" (line -1, col -1, in SOAP-message)com.eucalyptus.ws.WebServicesException: No unmarshaller for element "{http://msgs.eucalyptus.com/4.1.0}StartServiceType" (line -1, col -1, in SOAP-message)]
{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade 4.1.0->4.1.1 some java components fail to start

comments.body:
It seems that there were some orphaned processes on both the CLC/CC and UFS/WALRUS machines. I shut everything down and manually killed the processes that had been running since April21 and restarted. Everything is up and running now. 
{code}

Thanks [~mmunn1]. I will retest. I'm not sure how the processes got into that state and on 2 different hosts too. It's kind of odd.
[~tony] Make sure all the processes are killed before you upgrade, if we have orphaned processes after shutdown that may be a different bug.

Not a bug but a bad upgrade. Original upgrade was automated. It may be that EucaDeploy needs to handle things better. More testing with manual upgrade did not hit this issue.
